name: A Trip Through Wonderland - JamGame
description:
March 2021 libGDX 7 Day Game Jam Entry

Theme: Alice in Wonderland

**META NOTES**

This game was an excuse to mess around with some shaders.

Shoutout to Raeleus for his video on gdx-fx and shaders here and crashinvaders for the library itself here

Also, this was my least tested JamGame so far, should be alright. But I'll be playing around in it looking for crashes after the upload.

Anyways...

Your old pal, the White Rabbit? Well he needs some help. He's late for a Tea part of Sorts and need's your help.

Collect as many mushrooms as you can before time runs out or you die.

Avoid or kill Shroombeasts that spawn, to collect the mushrooms they drop.

Mushrooms you collect will NOT be scored unless you bring them back to the White Rabbit. At that point he will take your mushrooms and you will be cleansed of any ill effects. You may drop off mushrooms as many times as you like. But the deeper you go, the more risk you take getting back. Is it worth it? I don't know. The mushroom scoring is probably unbalanced, gimme a break.  Just play it for the experience. lol

*Notes:

There are 6 different mushrooms. Some more rare than others. Each one with a different effect.

Yellow Mushroom- 1 Point Health

Purple  Mushroom- Spawn More Shroombeasts

Red Mushroom-?

Pyramid Mushroom-??

Grey Mushroom - ????

??? Mushroom - ?????

*Controls:

W,A,S,D to Move, Space to Jump (You can Double Jump)

K to Light Attack

L to Heavy Attack

There is a combo you can do.  That will kill a Shroombeast in a single chain. Just mash around. Shouldn't be hard.

Assets Used:

Alice: I Recolored this sprite set https://clembod.itch.io/warrior-free-animation-set

TileSet: https://aamatniekss.itch.io/free-pixelart-tileset-cute-forest

and https://aamatniekss.itch.io/free-pixelart-platformer-tileset

Mushrooms: https://ssugmi.itch.io/fantasy-mushroom-pack

Enemy: https://luizmelo.itch.io/monsters-creatures-fantasy

Mushroom Spring: https://ansimuz.itch.io/sunnyland-enemies-extended-pack

All sounds and music found through https://freesound.org/

or https://sidearm-studios.itch.io/ultimate-sound-fx-bundle
